name: impact
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the force or action of one object hitting another

example.eg: The impact of the crash reduced the car to a third of its original length.
example.egtrans: 撞车时的冲击力使车身变形，仅剩原长的三分之一。

example.eg: The bullet explodes on impact (= when it hits another object).

trans_examp.trans_en: a powerful effect that something, especially something new, has on a situation or person
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指新事物的）巨大影响，强大作用

example.eg: The anti-smoking campaign had had/made quite an impact on young people.
example.egtrans: 禁烟运动对年轻人影响很大。

example.eg: The new proposals were intended to soften the impact of the reformed tax system.
example.egtrans: 新的提议旨在减轻改革后的税制所造成的影响。

name: impact
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have an influence on something

example.eg: Falling export rates have impacted (on) the country's economy quite considerably.
example.egtrans: 出口率的下降对该国的经济造成了相当大的影响。
